intro: Carlowrightia henricksonii, commonly known as the Henrickson's carlowrightia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
